resources.name: crop_data

fields.name: site
fields.title: Site Name
fields.description: Rothamsted

fields.name: plot_id
fields.title: Plot ID
fields.description: Fully qualified plot identifier

fields.name: plot
fields.title: Whole plot ID
fields.description: The original scheme plot number. In 1903 or 1920 most whole plots (1-17) were split in half with the southern half receiving lime (L) and the northern half unlimed (U). Three plots (18, 19, 20) were split in 1920 three-ways on their East-West axis (high lime HL, low lime LL and unlimed U). Refer to the reference for plan of experiment.

fields.name: split_plot
fields.title: Sub sub-plot ID
fields.description: The sub-sub-plot number; original plots that had been subsequently split in two  (4, 5, 11) or three (18, 19, 20)

fields.name: sub_plot
fields.title: Sub-plot ID
fields.description: In 1903 most whole plots had been split in half to make two sub-plots, with the southern half receiving lime (L) and the other no lime (U); plots 14, 15 and 17 were split in 1920; plots 5-1, 5-2, 6 and 12 were not included in the scheme

fields.name: year_of_split
fields.title: Year of split for limed vs unlimed plots
fields.description: Plots were either split to test liming in 1903 (1-9, 11-1, 11-2, 13, 16) or 1920 (14, 15, 17, 18-20) or not at all (5-1, 5-2, 6 and 12)

fields.name: subsequent_plots_1
fields.title: Subsequent plot name 1
fields.description: Subsequent plot name after first splitting; relevant to continuing dataset 1965-2018, see reference

fields.name: year_of_split_1
fields.title: Year of first splitting of plot
fields.description: Year plot was first split, relevant to continuing dataset 1965-2018, see reference

fields.name: subsequent_plots_2
fields.title: Subsequent plot name 2
fields.description: Subsequent plot name after second splitting; relevant to continuing dataset 1965-2018, see reference

fields.name: year_of_split_2
fields.title: Year of second splitting of plot
fields.description: Year of second split to plot, relevant to continuing dataset 1965-2018, see reference

fields.name: harvest_year
fields.title: Year in which crop harvested
fields.description: The year of cut; range 1903-1964

fields.name: treatments
fields.title: fertilizer treatment combination
fields.description: Full fertiliser treatment combination for plot

fields.title: N treatment
fields.description: Nitrogen fertilizer treatment

fields.name: n_rate
fields.title: Amount of  fertilizer N applied in that harvest year
fields.description: Nitrogen fertilizer amount

fields.name: liming_factor_level
fields.title: Lime treatment
fields.description: Whether lime applied or not

fields.name: liming_rate
fields.title: Amount of lime applied in that harvest year
fields.description: The amount of lime applied, as ground/slaked lime.  The years and amounts applied per application are included in the dataset and in related lime treatments publication, see reference

fields.name: fym_factor_level
fields.title: FYM treatment
fields.description: Farm yard manure fertilizer treatment

fields.name: fym_rate

fields.description: Farm yard manure fertilizer amount

fields.name: fm_factor_level
fields.title: Fish meal treatment
fields.description: Fish meal fertilizer treatment; applied until 1999

fields.name: fm_n_rate
fields.title: Amount of fishmeal applied in that harvest year
fields.description: Fish meal fertilizer nitrogen amount

fields.name: start_cut_1
fields.title: First cut harvest date start
fields.description: Start date of first cut harvest

fields.name: end_cut_1
fields.title: First cut harvest date end
fields.description: End date of first cut harvest

fields.name: start_cart_1
fields.title: First cut carting date start
fields.description: Start date of first cut produce removal from field; not 1960-1964 as new harvest method introduced, see reference

fields.name: end_cart_1
fields.title: First cut carting date end
fields.description: End date of first cut produce removal from field; not 1960-1964 as new harvest method introduced, see reference

fields.name: harvest_area_cut_1
fields.title: Area harvested
fields.description: Area of plot harvested

fields.name: yield_dry_matter_cut_1
fields.title: First cut  100% dry matter yield
fields.description: Yield at 100% DM dry matter for first cut; 1903-1959 whole plot harvested for hay; 1960-1964 yields estimated from strips using forage harvester, 'yield_dry_matter_cut_1_forage_harvester' data adjusted using a conversion factor [Corrected yield =0.2743 x (forage yield ^ 1.662)], see references

fields.name: yield_dry_matter_cut_1_forage_harvester
fields.title: First cut forage harvester 100% dry matter yield
fields.description: Yield of strip cut by forage harvester at 100% dry matter, 1960-1964, weighed immediately in the field, is used for yield value in 'yield_dry_matter_cut_1'. The remainder of the plot is mown and made into hay in the usual way, continuing earlier management and ensuring the return of seed. See references

fields.title: Second cut harvest date start
fields.description: Start date of second cut harvest

fields.title: Second cut harvest date end

fields.title: Second cut carting date start
fields.description: Start date of second cut produce removal from field

fields.name: end_cart_cut_2
fields.title: Second cut carting date end
fields.description: End date of second cut produce removal from field

fields.title: Area harvested

fields.name: yield_dry_matter_cut_2
fields.title: Second cut forage 100% dry matter yield
fields.description: Yield at 100% DM dry matter for second cut

fields.name: note_id
fields.title: Note
fields.description: Whether notes are applied or not

resources.title: Crop yield data
resources.description: Data table containing crop yield data for all plots and all treatments, 1903-1964. Includes details of all lime and fertilizer treatments applied. In 1960 there was a change in the harvest method and so data 1960-1964 is converted using a conversion factor (Bowley et al. 2017, Supplementary Materials)  to make it comparable to pre-1960 data

name: park-grass-hay-yields-1903-1964
title: Park Grass Hay Yields 1903-1964
description:
### Abstract
This dataset contains the yields of hay (t/ha), for both the 1st and 2nd cuts, harvested from Park Grass Hay Experiment since 1903-1964. Details of the fertilizer, lime treatments and harvest dates are also included. Originally one plot per treatment, in 1903, most plots were split into two to test the effects of liming, as acidity had built up with fertilizer use, with one half limed with chalk (L) and the other half left un-limed (U). In 1920 the remaining plots (14, 15 and 17) were split in half also, to join the liming scheme. Three other plots (18, 19 and 20) were split to three to receive light lime (LL), heavy lime (HL) and un-limed (U). Yields are provided for all fertiliser treatment plots and sub-plots. Yields are expressed as t/ha at 100% dry matter. Variations in yield reflect the various fertilizer treatments and liming regimes, as well as the local weather and atmospheric inputs. This data set is followed by that for 1965-2018 and so includes plot numbers (“subsequent plots”) from that later design-period to provide continuity between datasets.
### Methods
This experiment tests the effects of inorganic fertilizers, organic fertilizers and soil pH (which varies on sub-plots as a result of liming) on yields of hay. See Second Design Period 1903-1964 for detail. Until 1959, the yields were estimated by cutting and weighing the whole sub-plot produce. Since 1960, yields were estimated from strips cut from the centre of each plot with a forage harvester (in the dataset the forage harvester weight is converted using an equation from Bowley et. al – both values are provided). After the first cut in mid-June the remainder of each plot is mown and made into hay, continuing earlier management and ensuring return of seed. For the second cut, the whole of each plot is cut with a forage harvester.
### Technical Info
Hay yields have been recorded every year since the Park Grass experiment began, with the first harvest in 1856. Dried samples have also been kept since 1856 and these are preserved in the Rothamsted Sample Archive.
### Other
Park Grass was initiated to investigate the ways of improving the yield of hay by the application of inorganic fertilizers and organic manure. With time, the soil became more acidic and in 1903 plots had been halved and the effects of lime tested. From 1965 a new liming regime was initiated with four sub-plots, three receiving lime to maintain soil pH (0-23cm depth) at pH 7, 6, and 5 on sub-plots a, b and c. Sub-plot d does not receive any lime. These later yields are available in the dataset ‘Park Grass Hay Yields, Fertilizer and Lime Treatments 1965-2018’.
The change in harvest method in 1960 means recorded yields of dry matter are larger than previously as fewer losses occur. The previous harvest method estimated yield by weighing the produce from the whole field. See reference by Bowley et al (2017).
### Provenance
Individual plot yields are derived from the PGHAYEQUIV dataset in the e-RA database and were checked with the published yields in the annual Rothamsted Yield Books.
### Quality
In accordance with the Joint Code of Practice for Research at Rothamsted, data processing in e-RA follow rigorous standard operating procedures to ensure the quality and correctness of data collected in the field through to depositing in the e-RA database. To ensure quality control during data inputting, the data sets were typed on two separate occasions (double data entry). During the second typing (verification) the data values were compared with those typed on the earlier occasion, and any discrepancies were resolved before verification continued. This procedure also set out how to handle situations where the written records were illegible or ambiguous. This procedure avoided visual checking of data, which can be very inaccurate. Once the data were entered into e-RA, they were independently back-checked against the original data sheets.
